senses.sense_definition: An enclosed area at a baseball field where pitchers warm up before entering the game.

examples.text: The pitcher began to throw practice shots in the <w>bullpen</w>.
Fans cheered as the player walked from the <w>bullpen</w> to the mound.

senses.sense_definition: The group of relief pitchers on a baseball team considered collectively.

examples.text: The team has a very strong <w>bullpen</w> this season.
After the starter tired, the manager had to rely on his <w>bullpen</w> to finish the game.

senses.sense_definition: An open office layout without walls or partitions, designed to encourage communication among employees.

examples.text: The new office features a <w>bullpen</w> where the sales team works together.
Working in a <w>bullpen</w> can be noisy, but it helps us collaborate quickly.

senses.sense_definition: An enclosed pen or area used to hold bulls.

examples.text: The rancher moved the large animal into the <w>bullpen</w> for safety.
We repaired the fence around the <w>bullpen</w> before the rodeo started.

senses.sense_definition: A place or state where people or things wait until they are needed.

examples.text: We have several backup plans in the <w>bullpen</w> if this one fails.
The manager keeps a few talented interns in the <w>bullpen</w> for future projects.

senses.sense_definition: A temporary holding cell in a prison or a military stockade.

examples.text: The soldiers were detained in the <w>bullpen</w> overnight for disorderly conduct.
He spent a long night in the <w>bullpen</w> before seeing the judge.
